knowledge_graph.title: My Friendly Neighborhood
knowledge_graph.description: My Friendly Neighborhood is a survival horror game that has you roaming around a series of interconnected levels, gathering key items and solving some puzzles. The level design is surprisingly fantastic, with plenty of backtracking, puzzles, and secrets to find.
knowledge_graph.genres: Indie game, Adventure game, Puzzle, Shooter game, Adventure

related_questions.question: Where does My Friendly Neighborhood take place?
related_questions.snippet: We don't know exactly where My Friendly Neighborhood takes place, only that they have a huge studio lot with at least five sound stages. A letter reveals that their previous corporate sponsor was the City Network Broadcasting Group. The city has since gone under, with a bunch of shuttered lots.
related_questions.title: My Friendly Neighborhood Needs More Plausibility and Fewer Scary ...

related_questions.question: Is My Friendly Neighborhood based on Resident Evil?
related_questions.snippet: The other most obvious inspiration for My Friendly Neighborhood is in the moment-to-moment gameplay — it takes cues from classic survival-horror games (primarily the Resident Evil series) in forcing the player to navigate the labyrinthine corridors and secret passages of the studio complex, both to escape from the ...
related_questions.title: Resident Evil meets the Muppets in this fantastic survival-horror game

related_questions.question: Is My Friendly Neighborhood coming to consoles?
related_questions.snippet: Puppet-filled survival horror game My Friendly Neighborhood will launch for PC via Steam on July 18, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One at a later date, publisher DreadXP and developers John Szymanski and Evan Szymanski announced.
related_questions.title: Puppet-filled survival horror game My Friendly Neighborhood launches ...

related_questions.question: Is My Friendly Neighborhood for kids?
related_questions.snippet: My Friendly Neighborhood wears its inspirations, sure, but it's more than just a horror game made friendly for a younger audience. Its themes of non-violence, its goofy characters, and its approach to horror all convey much more depth than you — or certainly I — might've expected.
